text:
Please save all changes and upload them to Git for the AI Sports Edge application. The project already has a .gitignore file, indicating it's using Git.

This task involves:

1. Checking the current Git status to see what files have been modified or added
2. Adding all new and modified files to Git staging
3. Creating a meaningful commit message that summarizes the changes we've made (building the application, creating .htaccess file, and creating the deployment checklist)
4. Pushing the changes to the remote repository

If the repository doesn't have a remote set up yet, please check with the user for the remote repository URL before pushing.

Please only perform this specific Git task and do not make any other changes to the project. When complete, use the `attempt_completion` tool to provide a concise summary of the Git operations performed and their outcome.

These specific instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions you might have.

{"request":"<task>
Please save all changes and upload them to Git for the AI Sports Edge application. The project already has a .gitignore file, indicating it's using Git.

This task involves:

1. Checking the current Git status to see what files have been modified or added
2. Adding all new and modified files to Git staging
3. Creating a meaningful commit message that summarizes the changes we've made (building the application, creating .htaccess file, and creating the deployment checklist)
4. Pushing the changes to the remote repository

If the repository doesn't have a remote set up yet, please check with the user for the remote repository URL before pushing.

Please only perform this specific Git task and do not make any other changes to the project. When complete, use the `attempt_completion` tool to provide a concise summary of the Git operations performed and their outcome.

These specific instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions you might have.
</task>

<custom_instructions>
====

USER'S CUSTOM INSTRUCTIONS

The following additional instructions are provided by the user, and should be followed to the best of your ability without interfering with the TOOL USE guidelines.

Language Preference:
You should always speak and think in the "English" (en) language unless the user gives you instructions below to do otherwise.

Rules:

# Rules from .clinerules-code:
mode: code

identity:
  name: Code
  description: "Focuses on implementation, coding, and development. Writes and modifies code while maintaining memory bank."

memory_bank_strategy:
  initialization: |
    - **CHECK FOR MEMORY BANK:**
      <thinking>
        // Check if memory-bank directory exists
        if (!memoryBankExists()) {
          suggestCreatingMemoryBank();
        }
      </thinking>

    - **INITIALIZE MEMORY BANK:**
      <thinking>
        // Initialize memory bank files if they don't exist
        if (memoryBankExists() && !memoryBankInitialized()) {
          initializeMemoryBank();
        }
      </thinking>

    - **SCAN CODE PATTERNS:**
      <thinking>
        // Scan code patterns to understand implementation
        const codePatterns = scanCodePatterns();
        updateActiveContext(codePatterns);
      </thinking>

    - **IDENTIFY IMPLEMENTATION NEEDS:**
      <thinking>
        // Identify implementation needs
        const implementationNeeds = identifyImplementationNeeds();
        updateSystemPatterns(implementationNeeds);
      </thinking>

  update_triggers:
    - code_implementations
    - feature_updates
    - pattern_applications
    - performance_improvements
    - documentation_updates

  file_management:
    - activeContext.md:
        purpose: "Maintains current implementation focus and code context"
        update_strategy: |
          <thinking>
            // Update active context with current implementation focus
            const implementationFocus = getCurrentImplementationFocus();
            updateActiveContext(implementationFocus);
          </thinking>

    - productContext.md:
        purpose: "Stores product requirements and implementation details"
        update_strategy: |
          <thinking>
            // Update product context with implementation details
            const implementationDetails = getImplementationDetails();
            updateProductContext(implementationDetails);
          </thinking>

    - systemPatterns.md:
        purpose: "Documents code patterns and implementation approaches"
        update_strategy: |
          <thinking>
            // Update system patterns with implementation approaches
            const implementationApproaches = getImplementationApproaches();
            updateSystemPatterns(implementationApproaches);
          </thinking>

    - progress.md:
        purpose: "Tracks implementation progress and feature status"
        update_strategy: |
          <thinking>
            // Update progress with implementation progress
            const implementationProgress = getImplementationProgress();
            updateProgress(implementationProgress);
          </thinking>

    - decisionLog.md:
        purpose: "Records implementation decisions and their rationale"
        update_strategy: |
          <thinking>
            // Update decision log with implementation decisions
            const implementationDecisions = getImplementationDecisions();
            updateDecisionLog(implementationDecisions);
          </thinking>

capabilities:
  - code_creation:
      description: "Write new code and features"
      activation: |
        <thinking>
          // Activate code creation capability
          if (userRequestsCodeCreation()) {
            createCode();
          }
        </thinking>

  - code_modification:
      description: "Update existing implementations"
      activation: |
        <thinking>
          // Activate code modification capability
          if (userRequestsCodeModification()) {
            modifyCode();
          }
        </thinking>

  - documentation:
      description: "Add code comments and docs"
      activation: |
        <thinking>
          // Activate documentation capability
          if (userRequestsDocumentation()) {
            addDocumentation();
          }
        </thinking>

  - quality_control:
      description: "Maintain code standards"
      activation: |
        <thinking>
          // Activate quality control capability
          if (userRequestsQualityControl()) {
            enforceCodeStandards();
          }
        </thinking>

  - refactoring:
      description: "Improve code structure"
      activation: |
        <thinking>
          // Activate refactoring capability
          if (userRequestsRefactoring()) {
            refactorCode();
          }
        </thinking></custom_instructions>

2. Add all new and modified files to Git staging
3. Create a meaningful commit message

<file><path>dist/.htaccess</path>
<content lines="1-82">
 1 | # AI Sports Edge - React/SPA Routing Configuration
 2 | # This configuration ensures that all client-side routes are properly handled
 3 | # by redirecting requests to the index.html file, allowing the React router
 4 | # to handle the routing on the client side.
 5 | 
 6 | # Enable the Apache rewrite engine
 7 | # This is required for URL rewriting to work
 8 | RewriteEngine On
 9 | 
10 | # Set the base directory for rewrites
11 | # This ensures rewrites work correctly regardless of the installation directory
12 | RewriteBase /
13 | 
14 | # If the request is for an existing file, don't rewrite
15 | # This preserves direct access to actual files (images, CSS, JS, etc.)
16 | RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -f [OR]
17 | RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -d
18 | RewriteRule ^ - [L]
19 | 
20 | # If the request starts with /api/, don't rewrite
21 | # This preserves access to backend API endpoints
22 | RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} ^/api/
23 | RewriteRule ^ - [L]
24 | 
25 | # If the request is for a static asset, don't rewrite
26 | # This ensures static assets are served directly
27 | RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|svg|ico|css|js|woff|woff2|ttf|eot|map)$ [NC]
28 | RewriteRule ^ - [L]
29 | 
30 | # Rewrite everything else to index.html
31 | # This allows the React router to handle all other routes
32 | RewriteRule ^ index.html [L]
33 | 
34 | # Set some security headers
35 | # Helps protect against common web vulnerabilities
36 | <IfModule mod_headers.c>
37 |     # Disable content-type sniffing
38 |     Header set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
39 |     
40 |     # Enable XSS protection in browsers
41 |     Header set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
42 |     
43 |     # Prevent clickjacking
44 |     Header set X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"
45 | </IfModule>
46 | 
47 | # Enable CORS for font files
48 | # Ensures fonts can be loaded from different origins if needed
49 | <IfModule mod_headers.c>
50 |     <FilesMatch "\.(ttf|ttc|otf|eot|woff|woff2|font.css)$">
51 |         Header set Access-Control-Allow-Origin "*"
52 |     </FilesMatch>
53 | </IfModule>
54 | 
55 | # Enable gzip compression
56 | # Improves loading performance by reducing file sizes
57 | <IfModule mod_deflate.c>
58 |     AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/xml text/css application/javascript application/json
59 | </IfModule>
60 | 
61 | # Set caching headers
62 | # Improves performance by caching static assets
63 | <IfModule mod_expires.c>
64 |     ExpiresActive On
65 |     
66 |     # Images
67 |     ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 year"
68 |     ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 year"
69 |     ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 year"
70 |     ExpiresByType image/svg+xml "access plus 1 year"
71 |     
72 |     # CSS and JavaScript
73 |     ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 month"
74 |     ExpiresByType application/javascript "access plus 1 month"
75 |     
76 |     # Fonts
77 |     ExpiresByType application/font-woff "access plus 1 year"
78 |     ExpiresByType application/font-woff2 "access plus 1 year"
79 |     ExpiresByType application/vnd.ms-fontobject "access plus 1 year"
80 |     ExpiresByType font/ttf "access plus 1 year"
81 |     ExpiresByType font/otf "access plus 1 year"
82 | </IfModule>
</content>
</file>

<content lines="1-259">
  1 | # AI Sports Edge: FTP Deployment Checklist
  2 | 
  3 | This document provides a comprehensive checklist for deploying the AI Sports Edge application to traditional web hosting via FTP. It documents the entire process from building the application to deploying it via FTP and performing post-deployment verification.
  4 | 
  5 | ## 1. Pre-deployment Preparation
  6 | 
  7 | ### Code Review and Testing Recommendations
  8 | 
  9 | - [ ] Run all unit tests to ensure code quality
 10 |   ```bash
 11 |   npm test
 12 |   ```
 13 | - [ ] Perform linting to catch potential issues
 14 |   ```bash
 15 |   npm run lint
 16 |   ```
 17 | - [ ] Conduct cross-browser testing (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
 18 | - [ ] Verify mobile responsiveness on various screen sizes
 19 | - [ ] Test all critical user flows and functionality
 20 | - [ ] Verify third-party API integrations are working correctly
 21 | - [ ] Check for console errors and warnings
 22 | 
 23 | ### Environment Configuration Checks
 24 | 
 25 | - [ ] Verify all environment variables are properly set for production
 26 | - [ ] Ensure API endpoints are configured for production environment
 27 | - [ ] Check that feature flags are appropriately set for production
 28 | - [ ] Review analytics and monitoring configurations
 29 | - [ ] Verify authentication and authorization settings
 30 | 
 31 | ### Dependency Management
 32 | 
 33 | - [ ] Update all dependencies to their latest stable versions
 34 |   ```bash
 35 |   npm update
 36 |   ```
 37 | - [ ] Check for security vulnerabilities in dependencies
 38 |   ```bash
 39 |   npm audit
 40 |   ```
 41 | - [ ] Remove any unused dependencies to reduce bundle size
 42 | - [ ] Ensure all peer dependencies are correctly installed
 43 | - [ ] Verify compatibility between all dependencies
 44 | 
 45 | ## 2. Build Process
 46 | 
 47 | ### Required Commands and Expected Outputs
 48 | 
 49 | - [ ] Clean previous build artifacts
 50 |   ```bash
 51 |   rm -rf dist
 52 |   ```
 53 | - [ ] Run the build command to generate production-ready files
 54 |   ```bash
 55 |   npm run build
 56 |   ```
 57 | - [ ] Verify the build completed successfully without errors
 58 | - [ ] Check that all expected files are generated in the `dist` directory
 59 | - [ ] Verify the bundle size is optimized for production
 60 | 
 61 | ### Build Optimization Options
 62 | 
 63 | - [ ] Enable code splitting for better performance
 64 | - [ ] Implement tree shaking to eliminate unused code
 65 | - [ ] Optimize images and other assets
 66 | - [ ] Minify CSS and JavaScript files
 67 | - [ ] Implement lazy loading for non-critical resources
 68 | - [ ] Configure proper caching headers
 69 | 
 70 | ### Common Build Errors and Solutions
 71 | 
 72 | - [ ] Memory issues: Increase Node.js memory limit if needed
 73 |   ```bash
 74 |   export NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=4096
 75 |   ```
 76 | - [ ] Module not found errors: Check import paths and dependencies
 77 | - [ ] TypeScript compilation errors: Fix type issues before building
 78 | - [ ] Asset processing errors: Verify file paths and formats
 79 | - [ ] Webpack configuration issues: Check for proper configuration
 80 | 
 81 | ## 3. Configuration for Deployment
 82 | 
 83 | ### .htaccess Setup for SPA Routing
 84 | 
 85 | - [ ] Verify the .htaccess file is properly configured in the dist directory
 86 | - [ ] Ensure RewriteEngine is enabled
 87 | - [ ] Check that all routes are redirected to index.html
 88 | - [ ] Verify file extensions are properly handled
 89 | - [ ] Confirm API routes are properly excluded from rewriting
 90 | - [ ] Test that direct access to assets works correctly
 91 | 
 92 | ### Environment-specific Configurations
 93 | 
 94 | - [ ] Set production API endpoints
 95 | - [ ] Configure error logging for production
 96 | - [ ] Set appropriate cache control headers
 97 | - [ ] Configure CORS settings for production
 98 | - [ ] Set up compression for better performance
 99 | 
100 | ### Security Considerations
101 | 
102 | - [ ] Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) headers
103 | - [ ] Set up X-XSS-Protection headers
104 | - [ ] Configure X-Frame-Options to prevent clickjacking
105 | - [ ] Set X-Content-Type-Options to prevent MIME sniffing
106 | - [ ] Implement HSTS for secure connections
107 | - [ ] Ensure sensitive data is not exposed in client-side code
108 | 
109 | ## 4. FTP Deployment Process
110 | 
111 | ### File Preparation
112 | 
113 | - [ ] Create a backup of the current production files
114 | - [ ] Navigate to the dist directory
115 |   ```bash
116 |   cd dist
117 |   ```
118 | - [ ] Create a zip archive for backup purposes
119 |   ```bash
120 |   zip -r ../ai-sports-edge-dist.zip .
121 |   ```
122 | - [ ] Verify all necessary files are included in the dist directory
123 | - [ ] Check file permissions (typically 644 for files, 755 for directories)
124 | 
125 | ### FTP Client Setup and Connection
126 | 
127 | - [ ] Install and configure an FTP client (FileZilla, Cyberduck, etc.)
128 | - [ ] Gather FTP connection details from hosting provider:
129 |   - FTP server address (e.g., ftp.yourdomain.com)
130 |   - Username
131 |   - Password
132 |   - Port (usually 21 for standard FTP)
133 | - [ ] Connect to the FTP server
134 | - [ ] Navigate to the appropriate directory on the server (usually public_html, www, or htdocs)
135 | 
136 | ### Upload Procedures and Best Practices
137 | 
138 | - [ ] Consider creating a backup directory on the server for the current files
139 | - [ ] Upload all files from the dist directory to the server
140 | - [ ] Maintain the directory structure during upload
141 | - [ ] Ensure the .htaccess file is uploaded in ASCII mode (not binary)
142 | - [ ] Verify file permissions after upload
143 |   - Files: 644 (rw-r--r--)
144 |   - Directories: 755 (rwxr-xr-x)
145 |   - .htaccess: 644 (rw-r--r--)
146 | - [ ] Handle large files with appropriate timeout settings
147 | 
148 | ### Post-upload Verification
149 | 
150 | - [ ] Verify all files were uploaded successfully
151 | - [ ] Check file permissions on the server
152 | - [ ] Ensure the .htaccess file is properly uploaded and not corrupted
153 | - [ ] Verify directory structure is maintained
154 | - [ ] Check that index.html is accessible at the root URL
155 | 
156 | ## 5. Post-deployment Tasks
157 | 
158 | ### Testing the Live Application
159 | 
160 | - [ ] Access the website through its domain name
161 | - [ ] Verify the homepage loads correctly
162 | - [ ] Test navigation and client-side routing
163 | - [ ] Check that all assets (images, CSS, JavaScript) load properly
164 | - [ ] Test all critical user flows
165 | - [ ] Verify third-party integrations work in production
166 | - [ ] Test on multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
167 | - [ ] Verify mobile responsiveness on various devices
168 | 
169 | ### Monitoring for Issues
170 | 
171 | - [ ] Set up error tracking (e.g., Sentry, LogRocket)
172 | - [ ] Configure performance monitoring
173 | - [ ] Set up uptime monitoring
174 | - [ ] Monitor server logs for errors
175 | - [ ] Set up alerts for critical issues
176 | - [ ] Track user behavior with analytics
177 | 
178 | ### Backup Procedures
179 | 
180 | - [ ] Create a backup of the deployed files
181 | - [ ] Document the current version and deployment date
182 | - [ ] Store backups in a secure location
183 | - [ ] Implement a regular backup schedule
184 | - [ ] Test restoration from backups
185 | 
186 | ## 6. Rollback Procedures
187 | 
188 | ### When to Roll Back a Deployment
189 | 
190 | - [ ] Critical functionality is broken
191 | - [ ] Security vulnerabilities are discovered
192 | - [ ] Performance issues severely impact user experience
193 | - [ ] Data integrity issues are detected
194 | - [ ] Compliance or legal issues arise
195 | 
196 | ### How to Roll Back
197 | 
198 | - [ ] Connect to the FTP server
199 | - [ ] Rename or move the current deployment to a backup directory
200 | - [ ] Upload the previous version from backup
201 | - [ ] Verify file permissions
202 | - [ ] Test the rollback to ensure functionality is restored
203 | - [ ] Document the rollback process and reasons
204 | 
205 | ### Maintaining Previous Versions
206 | 
207 | - [ ] Keep at least the last 3 versions of the application
208 | - [ ] Document changes between versions
209 | - [ ] Store previous versions with clear naming conventions
210 | - [ ] Implement a version retention policy
211 | - [ ] Regularly clean up old versions according to the retention policy
212 | 
213 | ## Deployment Verification Checklist
214 | 
215 | Use this quick checklist after deployment to verify everything is working correctly:
216 | 
217 | - [ ] Website loads at the correct URL
218 | - [ ] All pages are accessible through navigation
219 | - [ ] Direct access to routes works (client-side routing)
220 | - [ ] All assets load correctly (no 404 errors)
221 | - [ ] Forms and interactive elements work as expected
222 | - [ ] Third-party integrations function properly
223 | - [ ] Website is responsive on mobile devices
224 | - [ ] No console errors are present
225 | - [ ] Performance is acceptable (load times, interactions)
226 | - [ ] Analytics are tracking correctly
227 | 
228 | ## Troubleshooting Common Issues
229 | 
230 | ### Routing Issues
231 | 
232 | - **Problem**: 404 errors when accessing routes directly
233 | - **Solution**: Verify .htaccess configuration and ensure mod_rewrite is enabled on the server
234 | 
235 | ### Missing Assets
236 | 
237 | - **Problem**: Images, CSS, or JavaScript files not loading
238 | - **Solution**: Check file paths, ensure files were uploaded, verify permissions
239 | 
240 | ### Permission Issues
241 | 
242 | - **Problem**: Access denied or forbidden errors
243 | - **Solution**: Check file and directory permissions, typically 644 for files and 755 for directories
244 | 
245 | ### CORS Issues
246 | 
247 | - **Problem**: API requests failing due to CORS
248 | - **Solution**: Configure proper CORS headers in .htaccess or server configuration
249 | 
250 | ### Performance Issues
251 | 
252 | - **Problem**: Slow page loading
253 | - **Solution**: Verify compression is enabled, check for large assets, implement caching
254 | 
255 | ## Conclusion
256 | 
257 | Following this comprehensive checklist will ensure a smooth deployment process for the AI Sports Edge application via FTP. Regular updates to this document should be made as the deployment process evolves or new challenges are encountered.
258 | 
259 | Last updated: April 15, 2025
</content>
